name: Ｍｅｄｉａ　ｉｎ　Ｅｎｇ．Ａ（１）-1Media in English A (1)-1

summary:
＊The focus is on all four skills and the desirable entry level is around 470 for TOEFL®
This course aims to develop students’ media analysis and discussion skills through viewing classic British TV comedy and drama.  We will be watching excerpts/episodes from Brideshead Revisited， Cracker， Pride and Prejudice， Lost in Austen， Dad’s Army， Fawlty Towers， The Remains of the Day, and other programmes. A secondary aim will be to introduce students to aspects of modern society and culture as represented over the past forty years of British television.  Topics will include Social class， Industry， Heritage， Gender roles and relations， Sport and sports-related violence.  For each topic the viewing materials will be supplemented by media reports on current developments in these areas.  Discussion exercises will focus on the usefulness of drawing comparisons between contemporary British and Japanese society.  The emphasis will be on discussion and analysis， but there will also be exercises in listening comprehension， dialect， dialogue， and vocabulary.
goals:
We will aim to improve media analysis skills， listening (to， amongst other things， non-standard Englishes， and discussion skills.  Students will complete the course with greater understanding of modern British history and society and the value of cross-cultural comparison.
The course is heavily orientated towards the use of audio-visual materials.

name: Ｍｅｄｉａ　ｉｎ　Ｅｎｇ．Ａ（２）-1Media in English A (2)-1

summary: This is an intermediate course for students who wish to improve their ability to understand and talk about the lighter news reports typically broadcast at the end of a television newscast. Each lesson is based around a short video clip taken from CBS News, an American television network. The clips explore social and cultural issues in Japan and America, spanning a range of topics from health and lifestyle to social activism and the media itself. The vocabulary exercises and video scripts that accompany each clip will help students cope with the fluent speech used by reporters and interviewees. Consideration of broader issues concerning the media such as representation, gender roles, and globalisation will be integrated into lessons where possible.
goals: Students will be more confident listening to authentic English news broadcasts. They will better understand news items as their ability to process natural speech and understand content improves.Supplementary tasks will give students the opportunities to discuss in more depth some of the topics covered in the course textbook.

name: Ｓｏｃｉｏｃｕｌ．Ｅｎｇ．Ａ（１）Sociocultural Topics in English A (1)

summary:
＊The focus is on all for skills and the desirable entry level is 430 and above for TOEFL
This course is a Speaking /Listening class using movies to present International culture as a basis for study.  A close look at American culture will be presented through movies and comparisons to Japanese and other cultures will be made and analyzed. Students will learn various communication strategies， enabling them to more fully express meanings in English. Students will be required to watch portions of movies in each class and answer questions on essay tests at the completion of each movie.  Students will be required to participate in discussions based on the characters and themes of the movies. This is a challenging class format， requiring full and committed participation on the part of all students in the class.  Attendance is a very important factor in receiving credit for this course.  Students will be required to do make up assignments for any classes missed in the semester with written reports. A TOEFL score of 430 is desirable to this lower intermediate English course.  Returnees (students that have lived abroad) and other students seriously interested in improving their English skills are welcome in this course.
goals: The goal of this course is for students to develop analytical and interpretive skills through analysis of movie content. Students will learn new Communication Strategies throughout the course， enabling them improve their communication in English.

name: Ｓｏｃｉｏｃｕｌ．Ｅｎｇ．Ａ（２）Sociocultural Topics in English A (2)

summary:
＊The focus is on all four skills and desirable entry level is 460 and above for TOEFL
In a more challenging format， this discussion based course will use movies to present the broad concept of how modern lifestyles are changing and what can be done to manage these changes. In addition， students will be required to demonstrate communicative competence and participate in all class discussions. More advanced methods for improving communicative competence will be introduced. Included in this approach， grammatical competence， as well as discourse  and strategic competence will be brought into focus. Students will watch portions of movies in each class and participate in discussions based on important contents and themes of the movies.  They will be required to answer questions on essay examinations at the completion of each movie. This is a very demanding class format， requiring full and committed participation on the part of all students in the class. Students will lose participation grades if they are not fully participating in classroom discussions or speaking Japanese in class. Regular attendance is a very important factor in receiving credit for this course.  Students will be required to do make up assignments for any missed assignments in the semester with written reports. A TOEFL score of 460 is desirable to this lower intermediate English course.  Returnees (students that have lived abroad) and other students seriously interested in improving their English skills are welcome in this course.
goals:
Course Objectives， Goals and Aims:
Students in this course will analyze lifestyle issues in order to obtain a broader understanding of their own cultural principles and new options available in society today.  In this class， students will develop an understanding of the differences in thought and behavior in other cultures， enabling them to make more informed decisions and choices in their own future.  The knowledge gained from this class will prepare the students to recognize potential opportunities and make life decisions and choices they may face in their lives after leaving the university.

name: Ｓｏｃｉｏｃｕｌ．Ｅｎｇ．Ａ（４）-1(Introduction to Gender Studies)Sociocultural Topics in English A (4)-1 (Introduction to Gender Studies)

summary:
This course will cover introductory issues in gender studies and is designed to give students a grounding in how gender is constructed in various situations in daily life.
Each class will consist of a short lecture, followed examination of reading or audio-visual materials, and then group discussions.  Articles or supporting materials will be assigned in advance, and students will be expected to come to class having prepared to engage with them.  They will also be expected to find related content from their own sources.　While the course is aimed at students with intermediate level English (around CEFR B1), interest in the area of study and enthusiasm is considered more important than English ability.
goals:
Students will gain a firm groundwork in social and cultural issues related to gender.  They will hone their ability to make international comparisons of gender issues through statistical data.  They will gain understanding of the international trends in the issues, and the current situation and initiatives of various (in particular English-speaking) countries. They should also acquire an ability to critically consider gender issues in Japanese society.  The knowledge gained will help them recognize issues they may face, and choices and life decisions they may have to make, after graduating the university.
The course should help them improve their listening and speaking skills, and allow them to handle and interpret statistical data in English.

summary: Culture, Ethics and Conflict Resolution: This is a demanding four-skills course, centred around applied theories of culture, ethics and conflict resolution. The class target is that students develop their critical thinking and the sophisticated vocabulary, expressive and strategic skills necessary for academic discussion. Grounded in a highly interactive, communicative approach, the course introduces a range of issues to be pursued in depth through individual research and presentations. Each week, reading or research will be set as preparative homework. Class time will build on this foundation, nurturing pair work and group activities. In addition to student presentations, there will be continuous assessment, frequent attainment checks and reflection reports throughout the course.
goals:

• Can understand specialised articles, films etc.　• Can formulate ideas and opinions and speak about them fluently. 　• Can express in writing in clear, well-structured text.

summary:
この授業は，派遣留学制度などを利用し，海外で学ぶことを希望している学生のためのクラスです。対象者は，すでに英語能力に自信のある人ではなく，これからの頑張りによって海外留学を実現させたいと考えている人です。
4技能Reading,Listening, Writing, Speakingの概要を学び，海外留学に必須となるTOEFLのスコアアップにつなげます。　自己紹介ではなく他者紹介を英語で行ったり，日本に関するテーマについて，個人あるいはグループで調べて，英語プレゼンテーションを行ったりします。　映画を鑑賞し，異文化交流についての理解を深めます。　また留学経験者の体験談を聞くことにより，留学へのモチヴェーションを高めましょう。

英語での発表やプレゼンテーションを行うことにより，英語コミュニケーションに慣れることができる。

name: 留学ワークショップ（１）-3Study Abroad Workshop (1)-3

summary:
この授業は，派遣留学制度などを利用し，海外で学ぶことを希望している学生のためのクラスです。対象者は，すでに英語能力に自信のある人ではなく，これからの頑張りによって海外留学を実現させたいと考えている人です。
4技能Reading,Listening, Writing, Speakingの概要を学び，海外留学に必須となるTOEFLのスコアアップにつなげます。　自己紹介ではなく他者紹介を英語で行ったり，日本に関するテーマについて,個人あるいはグループで調べて英語プレゼンテーションを行ったりします。　映画を鑑賞し，異文化交流についての理解を深めます。　また留学経験者の体験談を聞くことにより，留学へのモチヴェーションを高めましょう。
goals:
TOEFLの概要を理解することにより，スコアアップにつなげることができる。
英語での発表やプレゼンテーションを行うことにより，英語コミュニケーションに慣れることができる。
異文化交流に対する理解を深めることができる。

name: 留学ワークショップ（１）-4Study Abroad Workshop (1)-4

summary:
Recommended levels - CEFR B2+, TOEFL ITP 540+, TOEFL iBT 72+
This critical thinking and discussion course is designed to prepare students to express themselves and debate topics in English. Students will learn to communicate their opinions in a group setting, which is a common experience while studying abroad.　Students will prepare for and participate in challenging group discussions and debates.　Students will develop quick critical thinking skills.
goals: After completing this course, students will be more confident participating in group discussions and debates in English. Students will be able to come up with arguments for or against topics more quickly, and will have improved their critical thinking skills.

name: ＴＯＥＩＣ　Ｐｒｅｐａｒａｔｉｏｎ-1TOEIC Preparation-1

summary: この授業では，TOEIC（Listening & Reading Test）のスコア向上を目指す。受講者は，ほぼ毎回提出が求められるリスニングセクションとリーディングセクションの小課題（宿題）に取り組み，各Partの特質をつかみ，TOEICの問題を解く上で必要な知識や技術を身につける。小課題（宿題）と，3回の模擬テストなどを通して，受講者は自分の弱点を発見し，実力を向上させてもらいたい。
goals:
１）TOEICスコア向上のために必要な英文法の知識をしっかり身につける。
２）TOEICで頻出する単語やイディオムを身につける。
